what: Function names indicate the data source
title: Getting Started with baseballr
text: baseballr v1.0.0, function naming convention implemented data source indicator appear start function name: Functions use baseballr-data repository contain load_ update_ function name considered loading functions play--play data, team box scores, player box scores. Functions use MLB Stats API start mlb_ convention assumed get functions. baseballr version 1.3.0, package exports ~88 functions covering MLB Stats API. Functions use one Baseball Savant’s Statcast APIs start statcast_ convention assumed get functions. functions allow live access Statcast data MLB games -progress. baseballr version 1.3.0, package exports ~5 Statcast-related functions. Functions use Chadwick Bureau’s Public Register Baseball Players start chadwick_, playerid_, playername_ convention assumed get functions. functions allow access Bureau’s public register baseball players. baseballr version 1.3.0, package exports 3 functions sourced using Chadwick Bureau’s public register baseball players. Functions use Baseball Reference’s website start bref_ convention assumed get functions. baseballr version 1.3.0, package exports ~4 functions covering Baseball Reference. Functions use FanGraphs’s baseball website start fg_ convention assumed get functions. baseballr version 1.3.0, package exports ~11 functions covering FanGraphs.com. Functions use Retrosheet’s baseball data start retrosheet_ convention assumed get functions. baseballr version 1.3.0, package exports 1 function Retrosheet Data. Functions use NCAA website start ncaa_ convention assumed get functions. baseballr version 1.3.0, package exports ~8 function covering NCAA Stats portal.

text: Bill Petti Saiem Gilani

title: Plotting Statcast data
code: betts_id <- playerid_lookup("Betts") %>%   dplyr::filter(first_name == "Mookie") %>%   dplyr::select(mlbam_id, first_name, last_name)

what: scrape Betts’ Statcast data, by pitch removing those with a batted ball speed of 0
title: Plotting Statcast data
code: betts_15 <- statcast_search("2015-03-31", "2015-10-31", playerid = betts_id[1,1], player_type = 'batter') betts_16 <- statcast_search("2016-03-31", "2016-10-31", playerid = betts_id[1,1], player_type = 'batter')    betts <- dplyr::bind_rows(betts_15, betts_16) %>%   dplyr::mutate(Year = as.factor(substr(game_date,1,4))) %>%   dplyr::filter(type == "X") %>%   dplyr::filter(launch_speed != 0)

what: calculate average launch angles and batted ball speeds by game
title: Plotting Statcast data
code: betts_grpd <- betts %>%   dplyr::group_by(game_date) %>%   dplyr::summarise(     `Average Launch Angle` = mean(launch_angle, na.rm = TRUE),      `Average Batted Ball Speed` = mean(launch_speed, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   dplyr::ungroup() %>%   melt(id=c("game_date")) %>%   dplyr::mutate(Year = as.factor(substr(game_date,1,4)))

what: calculate Betts’ average launch angle and batted ball speed by year
title: Plotting Statcast data
code: betts_avg_speed_yr <- betts %>%   dplyr::group_by(Year) %>%   dplyr::summarise(     speed = round(mean(launch_speed, na.rm = TRUE),1),      angle = round(mean(launch_angle, na.rm = TRUE),1))

title: Plotting Statcast data
code:
betts_grpd %>%   ggplot(aes(game_date, value)) +   geom_point() +   stat_smooth(aes(group = Year, color = Year)) +   facet_wrap(~variable, scales = "free_y") +    ggtitle("
Mookie Betts: 2015 vs. 2016
") +    labs(subtitle = paste0("Betts has lowered his launch angle in 2016, from ", betts_avg_speed_yr[1,3], " degrees in 2015 to ", betts_avg_speed_yr[2,3], " degrees this year.

"),         caption = "@BillPetti
Data from baseballsavant.mlb.com
Data acquired with the baseballr package") +   ylab("Angle = Degrees, Speed = MPH
") +   xlab("
Date") +   #theme_bp_grey() +    theme(legend.position = "bottom", strip.text.x = element_text(face = "bold", size = 14), plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust=-.12)) +   scale_color_manual(values = c("#5F9ED1", "#FF800E"))

title: Using Statcast Pitch Data

what: Use Burnes’ ID To Load Statcast Data
title: Using Statcast Pitch Data
text: block download Corbin Burnes’ pitches March 1st December 1st.

title: Using Statcast Pitch Data
text: first time looking Statcast data recommend looking documentation dataset returned. ’ll walk data represented column give better idea data points collected pitch. common data points used pitching analysis: pitcher : Pitcher’s MLBAM ID pitch_name/pitch_type : Pitch Name/Type release_speed : Velocity pfx_z/pfx_x : Pitch Movement release_spin_rate : Spin Rate spin_axis : Spin Axis release_pos_z/release_pos_z/extension : Release Point plate_z/plate_x : Pitch Location Since ’re going making scatterplot Corbin Burnes’ pitch movement, need make sure data proper format match traditional movement plot. pfx_x pfx_z columns feet let’s create two new columns convert inches. pfx_x also catcher’s point view let’s also reverse pitcher’s.
code: # The glimpse function is something I use regularly # to quickly preview the data I'm working with. # Try it out if you haven't used it before! #  #  # burnes_data %>% dplyr::glimpse()  burnes_cleaned_data <- burnes_data %>%    # Only keep rows with pitch movement readings   # and during the regular season   dplyr::filter(!is.na(pfx_x), !is.na(pfx_z),                 game_type == "R") %>%    dplyr::mutate(pfx_x_in_pv = -12*pfx_x,                 pfx_z_in = 12*pfx_z)

title: Using Statcast Pitch Data
text: Now ’ve created new columns, let’s use plot Corbin Burnes’ pitches move.  like use pitch_name color scatterplots gives full pitch name legend, pitch_type also work prefer shorter abbreviations (ex: 4-Seam Fastball = FF). use pitch_type instead, sure make new vector colors.
code: # Make a named vector to scale pitch colors with pitch_colors <- c("4-Seam Fastball" = "red",                   "2-Seam Fastball" = "blue",                   "Sinker" = "cyan",                   "Cutter" = "violet",                   "Fastball" = "black",                   "Curveball" = "green",                   "Knuckle Curve" = "pink",                   "Slider" = "orange",                   "Changeup" = "gray50",                   "Split-Finger" = "beige",                   "Knuckleball" = "gold")  # Find unique pitch types to not have unnecessary pitches in legend burnes_pitch_types <- unique(burnes_cleaned_data$pitch_name)  burnes_cleaned_data %>%    ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x = pfx_x_in_pv, y = pfx_z_in, color = pitch_name)) +   ggplot2::geom_vline(xintercept = 0) +   ggplot2::geom_hline(yintercept = 0) +   # Make the points slightly transparent   ggplot2::geom_point(size = 1.5, alpha = 0.25) +   # Scale the pitch colors to match what we defined above   # and limit it to only the pitches Burnes throws   ggplot2::scale_color_manual(values = pitch_colors,                               limits = burnes_pitch_types) +   # Scale axes and add " to end of labels to denote inches   ggplot2::scale_x_continuous(limits = c(-25,25),                               breaks = seq(-20,20, 5),                               labels = scales::number_format(suffix = "\"")) +   ggplot2::scale_y_continuous(limits = c(-25,25),                               breaks = seq(-20,20, 5),                               labels = scales::number_format(suffix = "\"")) +   ggplot2::coord_equal() +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Corbin Burnes Pitch Movement",                 subtitle = "2021 MLB Season | Pitcher's POV",                 caption = "Data: Baseball Savant via baseballr",                  x = "Horizontal Break",                 y = "Induced Vertical Break",                 color = "Pitch Name")

title: Using Statcast Pitch Data
text: Now let’s take look Corbin Burnes’ pitch velo inning trademark cutter.
code: burnes_velo_by_inning <- burnes_cleaned_data %>%    dplyr::filter(pitch_name == "Cutter") %>%    dplyr::group_by(inning, pitch_name) %>%    dplyr::summarize(average_velo = mean(release_speed, na.rm = TRUE)) #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'inning'. You can override using #> the `.groups` argument.  burnes_velo_by_inning %>%    ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x = inning, y = average_velo, color = pitch_name)) +   ggplot2::geom_line(size = 1.5, alpha = 0.5, show.legend = FALSE) +   ggplot2::geom_point(size = 3, show.legend = FALSE) +   ggplot2::scale_color_manual(values = pitch_colors) +   ggplot2::scale_x_continuous(breaks = 1:9) +   ggplot2::scale_y_continuous(limits = c(90, 100)) +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Corbin Burnes Cutter Velo By Inning",                 subtitle = "2021 MLB Season",                 caption = "Data: Baseball Savant via baseballr",                 x = "Inning",                 y = "Average Velo")

title: Acquiring and Analyzing Baseball Data
text: baseballr package written R focused baseball analysis. includes functions scraping various data websites, FanGraphs.com, Baseball-Reference.com, baseballsavant.mlb.com. also includes functions calculating metrics, wOBA, FIP, team-level consistency custom time frames. can read functions use official site well Hardball Times article.

title: Acquiring and Analyzing Baseball Data
text: can install CRAN version baseballr : can install released version baseballr GitHub : experimental functions development, can install development branch:
code: install.packages("baseballr") # You can install using the pacman package using the following code: if (!requireNamespace('pacman', quietly = TRUE)){   install.packages('pacman') } pacman::p_load_current_gh("BillPetti/baseballr") # Alternatively, using the devtools package: if (!requireNamespace('devtools', quietly = TRUE)){   install.packages('devtools') } devtools::install_github(repo = "BillPetti/baseballr") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("BillPetti/baseballr", ref = "development_branch")

title: Acquiring and Analyzing Baseball Data
text: package consists two main sets functions: data acquisition metric calculation. example, want see standings specific MLB division given date, can use bref_standings_on_date() function. Just pass year, month, day, division want: Right now function works far back 1994, leagues split three divisions. can also pull data hitters specific date range. results hitters August 1st October 3rd 2015 season: terms metric calculation, package allows user calculate consistency team scoring run prevention year using team_consistency(): can also calculate wOBA per plate appearance wOBA contact set data date range, provided data available. Simply pass proper data frame woba_plus: can also generate wOBA-based stats, well FIP, pitchers using fip_plus() function:

text: x First season want data. y Last season want data. multiple years selected, data returned aggregate data date range. y = x, function return single-season data. league Option limiting results different leagues overall results. Options "al", "nl", "". qual Whether want batters/pitchers qualified given season, minimum number plate appearances inclusion. want qualified hitters, use qual. minimum number plate appearaces/innings pitched, use number desired. Defaults "y". pitcher_type Whether want starting pitchers, relievers, pitchers meet criteria specified qual argument. Options include "pit", "sta", "rel". ind Whether break seasons individual, roll together. 1 = split seasons, 0 = aggregate seasons.

text: function allows create spray charts ggplots given data frame batted ball location coordinates.

title: Generate spray charts with ggplot2 — ggspraychart
code: ggspraychart(   data,   x_value = "hc_x",   y_value = "-hc_y",   fill_value = NULL,   fill_palette = NULL,   fill_legend_title = NULL,   density = FALSE,   bin_size = 15,   point_alpha = 0.75,   point_size = 2,   frame = NULL )

title: Generate spray charts with ggplot2 — ggspraychart
text: data data frame includes batted ball coordinates. Typically, coordinates come GameDay xml feed downloads baseballsavant.com x_value x coordindate. Typically hc_x. y_value y coordinate. Typically hc_y. generally need inverse negative hc_y values, recommended calculate plotting. fill_value categorical variable want geom_points base fill . Pass string. left blank, defaults blue. fill_palette object containing customer palette used ggplot2::scale_fill_manual. fill_legend_title string containing custom legend title used ggplot2::scale_fill_manual. density Chooses 2d density plot point plot. Defaults FALSE. bin_size Size bins used building density plot. Defaults 15. point_alpha Alpha value whenever geom_point used. Defaults .75. Recommend .3 density plots. remove points density points set use point_alpha = 0. point_size Set size geom_point used. frame Variable use frame argument using gganimate create animated plots. density plots sure variable factor.

text: season Year(s) return return standings information . date Date return return standings information . standings_type standings_type(s) return standings information . Description standings_types regularSeason - Regular Season Standings wildCard - Wild card standings divisionLeaders - Division Leader standings wildCardWithLeaders - Wild card standings Division Leaders firstHalf - First half standings.  valid leagues split season (Mexican League). secondHalf - Second half standings. valid leagues split season (Mexican League). springTraining - Spring Training Standings postseason - Postseason Standings byDivision - Standings Division byConference - Standings Conference byLeague - Standings League league_id league_id(s) return standings information .

title: MLB Stats — mlb_stats
text: MLB Stats

title: MLB Stats — mlb_stats
code: mlb_stats(   stat_type = NULL,   player_pool = NULL,   game_type = NULL,   team_id = NULL,   position = NULL,   stat_group = NULL,   season = NULL,   league_id = NULL,   sport_ids = NULL,   sort_stat = NULL,   order = NULL,   limit = 1000,   offset = NULL )

title: MLB Stats — mlb_stats
text: stat_type Stat type return statistics . player_pool 4 different types player pools return statistics particular player pool across sport. Acceptable values include: , Qualified, Rookies, Qualified_rookies game_type Game type return information particular statistic particular game type. team_id Team ID return information ranking particular statistic particular team. position Position return statistics given position. Default "Qualified" player pool Acceptable values include: P C 1B 2B 3B SS LF CF RF DH PH PR BR SP RP CP UT UI UO RHP LHP RHS LHS LHR RHR B X stat_group Stat group return information ranking particular statistic particular group. season Year return information ranking particular statistic given year. league_id League ID return statistics given league. Default "Qualified" player pool. sport_ids sport_id(s) return information ranking information . sort_stat Sort return based stat. order Order return based either desc asc. limit limit limit return particular number records. offset offset returns +1 first record set players.

text: Returns tibble following columns

title: MLB Stats Leaders — mlb_stats_leaders
text: leader_categories League leader category return information ranking particular statistic. player_pool 4 different types player pools return statistics particular player pool across sport. Acceptable values include: , Qualified, Rookies, Qualified_rookies leader_game_types Game type return information ranking particular statistic particular game type. sit_codes Situation code return information ranking particular statistic particular game type. position Position return statistics given position. Default "Qualified" player pool Acceptable values include: P C 1B 2B 3B SS LF CF RF DH PH PR BR SP RP CP UT UI UO RHP LHP RHS LHS LHR RHR B X stat_group Stat group return information ranking particular statistic particular group. season Year return information ranking particular statistic given year. league_id League ID return statistics given league. Default "Qualified" player pool. sport_id sport_id return information ranking information . start_date Start date return information ranking particular statistic particular date range. Format: MM/DD/YYYY start_date must coupled end_date byDateRange stat_type end_date End date return information ranking particular statistic particular date range. Format: MM/DD/YYYY end_date must coupled start_date byDateRange stat_type stat_type stat_type return information ranking particular statistic particular stat type. limit limit limit return particular number records.

title: NCAA Functions Overview — ncaa
text: ncaa_scrape(): function allows user obtain batting pitching statistics school affiliated NCAA division , II, III levels. function acquires data NCAA's website (stats.ncaa.org) returns tibble. ncaa_baseball_pbp(): Get Play--Play Data NCAA Baseball Games. ncaa_baseball_roster(): Get NCAA Baseball Rosters. ncaa_game_logs(): Get NCAA Baseball Game Logs. ncaa_lineups(): Get NCAA Baseball Game Lineups. ncaa_park_factor(): Get Park Effects NCAA Baseball Teams. ncaa_schedule_info(): Get Schedule Results NCAA Baseball Teams. ncaa_school_id_lu(): Lookup NCAA School IDs (Division , II, III)

title: (legacy) Query Baseball Savant Leaderboards — scrape_savant_leaderboards
text: leaderboard type leaderboard retrieve, input string. Current options include exit_velocity_barrels, expected_statistics, pitch_arsenal, outs_above_average, directional_oaa, catch_probability, pop_time, sprint_speed, running_splits_90_ft. year season want data. abs minimum number batted balls. Applies exit_velocity_barrels leaderboards. min_pa Minimum number plate appearances. Can number 'q' qualified batters. min_pitches Minimum number pitches thrown. min_field Minimum number fieding opportunities. min_run Minimum number running opportunities. player_type One either 'batter' pitcher. expected_statistics leaderboard, 'batter-team' 'pitcher-team' also available. fielding_type One either 'player' 'team'. oaa_position Can either number position player '' '' position categories. oaa_roles Can either number position player '' '' position categories. team abbreviation team. Can left blank. arsenal_type One either 'n_', 'avg_spin', 'avg_speed'. run_type One either 'percent' 'raw'. min2b minimum number throwing attempts second base. min3b minimum number throwing attempts third base. position numeric position player. DH use 10. Can left blank. bats handedness batter. One 'R' 'L'. Can left blank. hand handedness pitcher. One 'R' 'L'. Can left blank.

title: Query Baseball Savant Leaderboards — statcast_leaderboards
code: statcast_leaderboards(   leaderboard = "exit_velocity_barrels",   year = 2018,   abs = 50,   min_pa = "q",   min_pitches = 100,   min_field = "q",   min_run = 0,   player_type = "batter",   fielding_type = "player",   oaa_position = "",   oaa_roles = "",   team = "",   arsenal_type = "n_",   run_type = "raw",   min2b = 5,   min3b = 0,   position = "",   bats = "",   hand = "" )

title: Query Baseball Savant Leaderboards — statcast_leaderboards
text: leaderboard type leaderboard retrieve, input string. Current options include exit_velocity_barrels, expected_statistics, pitch_arsenal, outs_above_average, directional_oaa, catch_probability, pop_time, sprint_speed, running_splits_90_ft. year season want data. abs minimum number batted balls. Applies exit_velocity_barrels leaderboards. min_pa Minimum number plate appearances. Can number 'q' qualified batters. min_pitches Minimum number pitches thrown. min_field Minimum number fieding opportunities. min_run Minimum number running opportunities. player_type One either 'batter' pitcher. expected_statistics leaderboard, 'batter-team' 'pitcher-team' also available. fielding_type One either 'player' 'team'. oaa_position Can either number position player '' '' position categories. oaa_roles Can either number position player '' '' position categories. team abbreviation team. Can left blank. arsenal_type One either 'n_', 'avg_spin', 'avg_speed'. run_type One either 'percent' 'raw'. min2b minimum number throwing attempts second base. min3b minimum number throwing attempts third base. position numeric position player. DH use 10. Can left blank. bats handedness batter. One 'R' 'L'. Can left blank. hand handedness pitcher. One 'R' 'L'. Can left blank.

See data-raw/archived/ last updated script. may re-visited later date improved data repository maturity. Retrosheet functions updated use tempdir()/tempfile() methods default. need specify working directory enable old functionality files written disk permanently. New default functionality return named list two tibbles per year specified: ‘events’ ‘rosters’.

title: baseballr 0.8 (2020-05-15)
text: Thanks Robert Frey, ’ve added new function allows user calculate park factors NCAA level. get_ncaa_park_factors takes two arguments; teamid, years, type. Users can submit single year multiple years (recommended) uses team’s schedule results calculate home park’s factors. Also, user selects conference type, park factor adjusted based number teams conference. practical effect suggesting regression applied players play fewer teams fewer parks. function return two versions park factor: base_pf final_pf, simply takes base_pf applies adjustment based FanGraphs’ method:
code: get_ncaa_park_factor(736, c(2017:2019),type = "conference")       school home_game away_game runs_scored_home runs_allowed_home runs_scored_away 1 Vanderbilt       104        91              782               416              591   runs_allowed_away base_pf home_game_adj final_pf 1               426   1.028         1.013    1.011  get_ncaa_park_factor(736, c(2017:2019),type = "division")       school home_game away_game runs_scored_home runs_allowed_home runs_scored_away 1 Vanderbilt       104        91              782               416              591   runs_allowed_away base_pf home_game_adj final_pf 1               426   1.031         1.014    1.011  get_ncaa_park_factor(736, c(2015:2019),type = "division")       school home_game away_game runs_scored_home runs_allowed_home runs_scored_away 1 Vanderbilt       175       154             1314               658              951   runs_allowed_away base_pf home_game_adj final_pf 1               680   1.209         1.098    1.093

title: baseballr 0.7 (2020-01-07)
text: release baseballr includes functions allow user query data MLB’s stats api minor league level. can view look table ?get_game_pks_mlb get appropriate IDs level, ’ll post well (comprehensive): Game information can acquired using get_game_pks_mlb function, along level want games: can also use get_game_info_mlb function grab additional info game, weather (cases) attendance: game_pk IDs grabbing pbp data simple. need pass game_pk interest get_pbp_mlb function. Let’s say interested Gwinnett Stripers versus Charlotte Knights: function return data frame 131 columns. Data availability vary depending park league level, sensor data available minor league parks via API. Also note column names mostly left -likely duplicate columns terms information provide. plan clean output road, now leaving majority -. columns interest minor league level : pitchNumber atBatIndex: pitch number within given plate appearance plate appearance within given game. pitchData.coordinates.x pitchData.coordinates.y: x,z coordinates pitch crosses plate. far can tell, pixel coordinates location stringer manually plots likely need transformed rotated get view pitch crosses plate. working figuring easy transformation get scale MLB coordinates, appear different park. believe can multiple -1 least allow orient coordinates correctly (.e. catcher’s view) details.call.code, details.call.description, result.event, result.eventType, result.description: similar find Statcast data–codes detailed descriptions happened pitch end plate appearance. count. variables tell many balls, strikes, outs pitch. batter.id pitcher.id matchup.batSide.code matchup.pitchHand.code: handedness batter pitcher. series columns tell league level home away teams includes parent organizations. batted.ball.result, hitData.coordinates.coordX, hitData.coordinates.coordY, hitData.trajectory: various information batted ball. interest coordinate columns.

text: fg_pitch_leaders() function compliment fg_bat_leaders() function, returning leaderboard information pitchers FanGraphs.com. addition noting start end years, along qualified/IP requirements, etc., can note whether want pitchers, starters, just relievers using pitcher_type argument. pit give pitchers meet requirements sta gives starters rel gives relievers scrape_statcast_leaderboards() scrape_statcast_leaderboards() function can used access leaderboards available BaseballSavant csv downloads. function isn’t anything sophisticated; simply builds appropriate url csv download based series parameters reads csv R. Users specify leaderboard want download using leaderboard argument. following currently available: exit_velocity_barrels expected_statistics pitch_arsenal outs_above_average directional_oaa catch_probability pop_time sprint_speed running_splits_90_ft leaderboard different parameters can specific alter content downloads, parameters work every leaderboard. (check leaderboard interface BaseballSavant directly sure ones use.) leaderboards include variable year selected, function check exists , , add column based parameter setting. example expected_statistics leaderboard pitchers faced least 250 batters 2018: milb_batter_game_logs_fg() milb_pitcher_game_logs_fg() functions contributed Mat Adams, similar game log functions included earlier release except return minor league game logs player specified. functions take two arguments: playerid year. playerid minor league ID assigned FanGraphs. can found url slug minor league player’s page. example, url Vladimir Guerrero Jr.’s minor league game logs: https://www.fangraphs.com/statsd.aspx?playerid=sa920245&position=3B&gds=&gde= see playerid= portion url, actual ID follows (.e. sa920245).

title: baseballr 0.3.4 (2018-05-29)
text: run_expectancy_code() function formats Baseball Savant data users can generate run expectancy different base-count-base-states. also append data frame new variables necessary generating linear weights (see new function ). argument data frame downloaded Baseball Savant Columns created appended Baseball Savant data: final_pitch_game: whether pitch final one thrown game final_pitch_inning: whether pitch final one thrown inning final_pitch_at_bat: whether pitch final one thrown bat runs_scored_on_pitch: many runs scored result pitch bat_score_start_inning: score batting team beginning inning bat_score_end_inning: score batting team end inning bat_score_after: score batting team pitch thrown cum_runs_in_inning: many cumulative runs scored beginning inning pitch runs_to_end_inning: many runs scored result pitch end inning base_out_state count_base_out_state: specific combination base-outs count-base-outs pitch thrown avg_re: average run expectancy base-count-base-state next_avg_re: average run expectancy base-count-base-state results pitch change_re: change run expectancy result pitch re24: total change run expectancy end inning resulting pitch based change base-count-base-state plus number runs scored result pitch/bat Example: run_expectancy_table() functions works run_expectancy_code function work generating run expectancy tables automatically exported Global Environment Example: linear_weights_savant() function works tandem run_expectancy_code() generate linear weights offensive events Baseball Savant data properly formatted. Currently, function return linear weights average linear weights outs. apply scaling align league wOBA. Users can like, may added future version function. Example: used Baseball Savant data 2010-2015 compared linear weights generated baseballr Tom Tango using retrosheet data. baseballr’s weights generally little lower Tango generated, due number things, data source, code, etc., values appear reasonable enough reliable: also great contributions others ’ve added release: label_statcast_imputed_data() Ben Dilday contributes cool experimental function meant tag batted ball cases significant imputation may used generate Statcast values MLBAM, .e. launch_speed launch_angle. can read Ben’s function . fg_park() Sam Boysel updated park factors function now includes new columns added FanGraphs (5-year, 3-year, 1-year park factors) ensures column names correct

Previous functions scrape_statcast_savant_batter scrape_statcast_savant_pitcher allowed acquistion data baseballsavant.com given player user-determined time frame. However, somewhat inefficient want acquire data players given time frame. Two new functions added, scrape_statcast_savant_batter_all scrape_statcast_savant_pitcher_all, allow user acquire data either pitchers hitters given time frame. functions take two arguments: start_date: first date user wants records returned end_date: final date user wants records returned Remember, baseballsavant.com’s csv download option allows 50,000 records single query. works roughly 10-12 days games. Longer time frames take longer download. Example: acquire data batters 2017-04-03 2017-04-10

title: baseballr 0.3.2 (2017-09-12)
text: latest release baseballr package R includes number enhancements bug fixes. terms new functions, statline_from_statcast allows users take raw pitch--pitch data Statcast/PITCHf/x calculate aggregated, stat line-like output. Examples include count data number singles, doubles, etc., well rate metrics like Slugging wOBA swings contact. function two arguments: df: data frame includes pitch--pitch information. function assumes following columns present: events, description, game_date, type. base: base indicates denominator rate stats calculated. function defaults “swings”, can also choose use “contact” example using data week 2017-09-04. , want see statline hitters based swings: can also combine statline_from_statcast function loop create statlines multiple players . Example: calculate statlines batters contact games played 2017-09-04 2017-09-10:
code: test <- scrape_statcast_savant_batter_all("2017-09-04", "2017-09-10")  statline_from_statcast(test)  year swings batted_balls  X1B X2B X3B  HR swing_and_miss swinging_strike_percent    ba 1 2017  13790        10663 1129 352  37 259           3127                   0.227 0.129  obp   slg   ops  woba 1 0.129 0.216 0.345 0.144 test <- scrape_statcast_savant_batter_all("2017-09-04", "2017-09-10")  output <- data.frame()  for (i in c("Jose Ramirez", "J.D. Martinez", "Francisco Lindor", "Gary Sanchez", "Rhys Hoskins")) {   reduced_test <- test %>%     filter(player_name == i)   x <- statline_from_statcast(reduced_test, base = "contact")   x$player <- i   x <- x %>%     select(player, everything())   output <- rbind(output, x) %>%     arrange(desc(woba)) }  print(output, width = Inf)  # A tibble: 5 x 12             player  year batted_balls   X1B   X2B   X3B    HR    ba   obp   slg   ops  woba              <chr> <chr>        <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> 1    J.D. Martinez  2017           17     4     1     0     7 0.706 0.706 2.000 2.706 1.092 2     Gary Sanchez  2017           11     3     1     0     2 0.545 0.545 1.182 1.727 0.710 3 Francisco Lindor  2017           27     4     2     1     3 0.370 0.370 0.852 1.222 0.498 4     Rhys Hoskins  2017           14     2     1     0     2 0.357 0.357 0.857 1.214 0.495 5     Jose Ramirez  2017           16     0     0     0     3 0.188 0.188 0.750 0.938 0.370

title: baseballr 0.2.1 (2016-10-08)
text: Updates functions release: scrape_statcast_savant_batterscrape_statcast_savant_pitcher New functions release: code_barrel research team Major League Baseball Advanced Media developed way categorize batted balls average batting average .500 slugging 1.500. specific coding criteria can found comment #2 [] (http://tangotiger.com/index.php/site/comments/statcast-lab-barrels#2). Now, whenever user scrapes Statcast data using either scrape_statcast_savant_batter scrape_statcast_savant_pitcher functions results include column barrel, batted ball matches barrel criteria code 1, otherwise 0. Example: already Statcast data–say, database ’ve collecting–’ve also included simple function take dataframe code whether row contains barrel . need pass dataframe code_barrel.
code: > scrape_statcast_savant_batter(start_date = "2016-04-06", end_date = "2016-04-15", batterid = 621043) %>%  +     filter(type == "X") %>% +     filter(!is.na(barrel)) %>% +     select(player_name, game_date, hit_angle, hit_speed, barrel) %>% +     tail() [1] "Be patient, this may take a few seconds..." title: baseballr 0.2.0 (2016-08-25)
text: Functions added release: scrape_statcast_savant_batterscrape_statcast_savant_pitcherplayerid_lookup two savant functions allow user retrieve PITCHf/x Statcast data either specific batter pitcher [Baseball Savants’ Statcast Search] (https://baseballsavant.mlb.com/statcast_search). user needs provide start date, end date, batter pitcher’s MLBAMID. Example: Since savant functions require users pass valid MLBAMID, lookup function included leverages Chadwick public register. Users provide text string players string present last name returned. example user looking players last name “Seager”:
code: > scrape_statcast_savant_batter(start_date = "2016-04-06", end_date = "2016-04-15", batterid = 621043) %>%       filter(type == "X") %>%      select(3,7,54:56) %>%      tail() [1] "Be patient, this may take a few seconds..."
